Package external_sort

Class OptimizedExternalSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • external_sort.ExternalSort<T>
      • external_sort.OptimizedExternalSort<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the elements
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<T>
    public abstract class OptimizedExternalSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
extends ExternalSort<T>
    An OptimizedExternalSort sorts data elements in ascending order according to the natural ordering of the elements. An OptimizedExternalSort can also be used as an Iterator over all of these sorted data elements. OptimizedExternalSort is faster than ExternalSort due to its lower disk I/O overhead.
    Author:
    Jeong-Hyon Hwang (jhh@cs.albany.edu)

                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructs an OptimizedExternalSort
        Parameters:
        iterator - the input Iterator
        degree - the number of runs that are merged together to form a new run
        bufferSize - the buffer size
        fileNamePrefix - the prefix that all of the run names (i.e., the names of the run files) will commonly have
        out - a PrintStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found
